awd_titl_txt: Syntheses of Graphyne and Model Systems
awd_abstract_narration: This starter grant award to the University of Oregon will                       support the research of Professor Michael Haley. The major                      focus of the research is the synthesis and characterization of                  extended carbon networks and molecules with a high C:H ratio.                   Based on MNDO calculations, a low energy phase of carbon                        consisting of stacked, planar carbon layers equally occupied by                 sp2 and sp states should be stable. The synthesis of such                       structures will be carried out based on palladium-catalyzed                     cross coupling reactions of polyacetylenes. The extended carbon                 networks will be characterized by x-ray and solid state NMR                     techniques.                                                                     %%%                                                                             The properties of these novel carbon networks will be of great                  relevance in the search for organic conductors, electrochromic                  display materials, liquid crystals, synthetic ferromagnets and                  nonlinear optical materials.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
